alert.note: Alert for Kent (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 02 at 10:31AM EDT until April 07 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING TO FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grand River near Comstock Park. * WHEN...From Monday evening to Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of homes along Abrigador Trail. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:47 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 12.3 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.3 feet on 03/08/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
